90519BOS01-d-05-19-89-ATK.Narrative: AT 4:18 A.M., ON MAY 19, 1989, AMTRAK TRAIN 49 TRAVELING WEST ON TRACK 2 AT M.P. 372 ON THE CONRAILCHICAGO MAINLINE WAS STRUCK BY PIECES OF LUMBER THAT SHIFTED FROM THE CONRAIL TRAIN NFSE 9. THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED AT JEFFERSON AND SILVER STREETS ONE MILE WEST OF THE AMTRACK STATION AT ROCHESTER, NEWYORK. PIECES OF LUMBER CAME THROUGH THE WINDOW OF AMTRAK ENGINE 228. 0410003-d-05-19-89-CR.Narrative: CONRAIL TRAIN NFSE-9 WAS OPERATING EASTBOUND ON MAIN TRACK #1, CHICAGO LINE. AMTRAK TRAIN #49 WAS OPERATING WESTBOUND ON MAIN TRACK #2 JUST WEST OF ROCHESTER STATION. WHILE THE TWO TRAINS WERE OPERATING BY EACH OTHER, A SHIFTED LOAD OF LUMBER FROM NFSE-9 (SHIFTED TO SOUTH) AND CAUSED RAKING COLLISION. LUMBER STRUCK LEAD UNIT #228 OF TRAIN #49, CAUSING FATALITY TO AMTRAK FIREMAN P.L. SYLVESTER, WHOWAS OPERATING LEAD UNIT 228 OF THE TRAIN AT THAT TIME. AMTRAK LEAD UNIT WAS SEVERLY DAMAGED AS A RESULT. NO INJURIES OR DAMAGE SUSTAINED BY CONRAIL EMPLOYEES OR EQUIPMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
